etymologies: mid 19th century. From ancient Greek ϕυλή tribe, clan, political division in Attica, cavalry unit provided by a phyle from an extended form of the same Indo-European base as ancient Greek ϕύειν to bring forth, to make grow

definitions: Any of various social groups or political divisions within a community, based on or sustained by ties of kinship; a tribe, a clan; especially a major political division in Attica created by the reforms of Cleisthenes (507 b.c.) and having various administrative, military, and social functions.

notes.text: The ten new phylai brought into being by the political reorganization of Cleisthenes were established initially on a geographical basis, although membership thereafter became hereditary in the male line.

definitions: A cavalry unit provided and manned by an Attic phyle.
